name: Israeli Salad
description: I spent a semester of my college career in Tel Aviv and developed a strong taste for Israeli salad, which more correctly traces its roots to a Palestinian origin. The combo is a simple mix of diced fresh vegetables, lemon, juice, and oil.
recipeIngredient: 2 medium roma tomatoes, seeded and diced (about 3/4 cup)
3 tablespoons finely minced fresh flat-leaf parsley
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed juice from 1 lemon
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, mix together tomatoes, cucumber, red pepper, onion, and parsley.
Add oil, lemon juice, and za’atar and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
